data.title: Paul Ferrier: Analyst intern at MarketScreener
data.meta_description: Find the latest articles by Paul Ferrier on MarketScreener. ...
data.text:
Booking Holdings: A weak outlook

Booking Holdings, the online booking giant, unveils its results for the second quarter of 2024. Despite figures that beat expectations, the stock plummets. So, what's going on at the king of overnight stays?

August 02, 2024 at 07:31 pm IST

Despicable Me: Trump-Gru and the European Minions

With the US presidential elections fast approaching, Europe is preparing for a possible Trump victory. And according to a new article in the Financial Times, EU authorities have already drawn up a two-stage plan.

August 01, 2024 at 08:17 pm IST

Trane Technologies heats up

Trane Technologies' share price climbs 4% following the announcement of its quarterly results. With such robust figures, it's fair to say that Trane Technologies is blowing hot, but certainly not cold.

July 31, 2024 at 08:26 pm IST

Procter & Gamble: Unexpected stagnation

Consumer products giant Procter & Gamble saw its share price fall by 6.4% following the publication of disappointing quarterly results. Weak demand in China and falling prices in the West seem to be taking their toll. What's going on at the consumer goods behemoth?

July 30, 2024 at 09:20 pm IST

Alphabet: Cloud boosts results, but YouTube flounders!

Alphabet Inc. the parent company of Google, has unveiled its results for the second quarter of 2024. Robust figures, but some concerns, as evidenced by the 4% fall in the share price.

July 24, 2024 at 07:30 pm IST

Verizon Communications struggles to sell smartphones

Verizon Communications posted mixed quarterly results, marked by a drop in wireless equipment sales and revenues that fell short of analysts' expectations. However, the company remains optimistic for the second half of 2024.

July 23, 2024 at 01:53 pm IST

Matrix Reloaded: Neo is Back!

In a scenario worthy of a Hollywood blockbuster, former President Donald Trump miraculously survived an assassination attempt at a campaign rally in Butler, Pennsylvania. Like in "The Matrix", Trump dodged bullets. The image of him, scarred but still standing, fist raised, with the American flag flying in the sky, quickly became iconic. His supporters now portray him as the chosen one.

July 19, 2024 at 02:28 pm IST

Howmet Aerospace: A spin-off that conquers the skies

Born of the Arconic spin-off in 2020, Howmet Aerospace specializes in engineering for the aerospace, transportation and other industrial sectors. The company equips iconic aircraft such as the Boeing 737 MAX, the Airbus A320 and the F-35. With a market capitalization of $32.7 billion and impressive margin growth, Howmet is proving that its post-spin-off boom is just beginning.

July 11, 2024 at 08:22 pm IST

Trex Company: The decking giant

Trex Company, founded in 1996 following the acquisition of the technology developed by Roger Wittenberg, is today the world's largest manufacturer of alternative wood decking and railing, with around 50% of the market. After two years of economic slowdown, the company is expected to achieve record sales in 2024, and anticipates continued growth over the next five years.

May 27, 2024 at 02:23 pm IST

Martin Marietta Materials: A success built stone by stone

In the space of a decade, Martin Marietta Materials has become one of the leaders in aggregates extraction in the United States, on the strength of a well-oiled acquisition strategy. Despite a slowdown in the construction sector in 2023, Martin Marietta has not only held its ground, but has also seen its margins and sales reach record levels. With the gradual upturn in construction and the passage of legislation in favor of infrastructure investment, Martin Marietta is well positioned to capitalize on these trends.

May 20, 2024 at 07:53 pm IST

A return to normality for the airport sector?

Four years after the start of the Covid-19 crisis, airports are finally beginning to see the light at the end of the tunnel. The pandemic, which severely impacted air transport, seems to be giving way to a gradual recovery.

May 03, 2024 at 02:34 pm IST

Packaging Corporation of America : Solid board

Packaging Corporation of America (PCA) was born in 1959 from the merger of several small companies. Through organic growth and acquisitions, the company has become North America's third-largest packaging producer, with over 14,000 customers. After a disappointing 2023 for the sector as a whole, the upturn in demand in 2024 should benefit PCA, which stands out for its superior fundamentals.

April 29, 2024 at 02:49 pm IST

Ingersoll Rand: A new era for the compressor manufacturer

Since its restructuring in 2020, Ingersoll Rand, a manufacturer of pumps and compressors, has outperformed its sector in terms of growth. This performance is the result of an aggressive acquisition strategy, made possible by the company's ability to generate substantial cash flow.

April 15, 2024 at 02:46 pm IST

Globe Life, a fraudulent insurer?

On Thursday, Globe Life found itself at the heart of a scandal following damning revelations by Fuzzy Panda Research, a short-seller, highlighting widespread fraudulent practices. The insurer, formerly backed by Warren Buffett, lost over 56% of its market value in a single day.

April 12, 2024 at 03:38 pm IST

ITT: From SME, to Conglomerate, to Specialization

ITT, an American industrial manufacturer, is entering a phase of expansion after a decade of stagnation. The company's growth forecasts, rising shareholder returns and steadily improving margins could spark investor interest in the stock.

April 08, 2024 at 03:04 pm IST

Idexx Laboratories: Superior growth prospects

Don't be fooled by the puppies and kittens in the illustration, IDEXX Laboratories means serious business. It deployed a formidable model. A specialist in animal health, the company charms investors with constantly expanding margins and sales. It has built a veritable fortress (Warren Buffett calls it a MOAT) around its diagnostic products and services, which guarantee recurring revenues. In addition, the company is very generous with its shareholders, who are rewarded with substantial share buy-backs.

March 11, 2024 at 10:48 pm IST

Bitter taste for chocolate lovers as cocoa prices soar

Chocolate lovers beware, the cocoa market has taken off in recent months, with prices literally doubling in the space of a year. These soaring costs, fueled by disappointing harvests in West Africa and exacerbated by the El Niño weather phenomenon, may bring difficult times for consumers and chocolate manufacturers alike.

February 14, 2024 at 10:56 pm IST

Indices: From European shores to American ones

The smaller European markets have started the year well. Greece dominates, building on the success of 2024. The Netherlands and Denmark did not disappoint, as each is home to a star of the European stock market: ASML for the former and Novo Nordisk for the latter. We conclude with a trip to the United States, where the return to favor of mid-caps will have to wait.

February 07, 2024 at 09:17 pm IST
